duplicates.key: aircraft-general-knowledge||if an artificial feel unit were fitted it would be connected:||in series with the primary controls
aircraft-general-knowledge||an impulse coupling in a magneto is provided to:||generate high voltage and retard the spark for starting

aircraft-general-knowledge||what type of fire extinguisher would be used on a propane fire?||foam
aircraft-general-knowledge||a twin jet aircraft would normally be refuelled by which of the following methods?||pressure refuelling
aircraft-general-knowledge||the purpose of a refuelling volumetric top off unit (vto) is:||to close the fuelling valve when the tank is full
aircraft-general-knowledge||where is egt measured?||hp turbine outlet
aircraft-general-knowledge||an ion detector detects:||smoke
aircraft-general-knowledge||load shedding is:||overall reductions of the loads on the system
aircraft-general-knowledge||epr is measured by the ratio of:||exhaust pressure to low pressure compressor inlet pressure
aircraft-general-knowledge||in a twin jet fuel system what is the function of a feeder box?||to prevent pump cavitation
aircraft-general-knowledge||the function of the baffles in a fuel tank is:||to prevent fuel surge (or sloshing) during manoeuvring

aircraft-general-knowledge||the advantage of a float type fuel gauging system is: 1. simple 2. compensates for variations of sg 3. reads fuel quantity by mass 4. compensates for change of aircraft attitude||1 only
aircraft-general-knowledge||on what principle do smoke detectors work?||optical and ionization
aircraft-general-knowledge||the purpose of a ditching control valve is:||to close the outflow valves
aircraft-general-knowledge||the correct extinguisher to use on a brake fire would be:||dry powder
aircraft-general-knowledge||in a centrifugal compressor:||the air enters the impeller axially at the eye and leaves at the periphery tangentially
aircraft-general-knowledge||if an aircraft maximum operating altitude is limited by the pressure cabin, this limit is due to:||the maximum positive pressure differential at maximum operating ceiling
aircraft-general-knowledge||hydraulic reservoirs are pressurized by:||engine bleed air from turbine engine
aircraft-general-knowledge||what happens to pressure, temperature and velocity of the air in the diffuser of a centrifugal compressor?||velocity decrease, pressure and temperature increase
aircraft-general-knowledge||a shuttle valve will:||automatically switch to a more appropriate source of hydraulic supply
aircraft-general-knowledge||the passenger oxygen drop-down mask stowage doors are released:||electrically for chemical oxygen generators and pneumatically for gaseous system
aircraft-general-knowledge||an underinflated tyre on a dry runway:||increases wear on the shoulder
aircraft-general-knowledge||long haul aircraft are not used as short haul aircraft because:||structures are given fatigue lives based on their use

aircraft-general-knowledge||an aircraft is certified to fly higher than 25 000 ft and to carry a maximum of 240 passengers, it is configured to carry 200 and actually has 180 passengers on board. the minimum number of drop-down oxygen masks provided must be:||220
aircraft-general-knowledge||an undercarriage leg is considered to be locked when:||mechanically locked by an "over-centre" mechanism
aircraft-general-knowledge||the purpose of a hydraulic fuse is to:||prevent loss of system fluid if the pipeline to a brake unit should rupture
aircraft-general-knowledge||the flight deck warning on activation of an engine fire detection system is:||warning light and warning bell
aircraft-general-knowledge||with regard to an air cycle type ecs pack, where is the water separator fitted?||after the cold air unit turbine

aircraft-general-knowledge||the properties of duralumin are: 1. aluminium/copper base 2. aluminium/magnesium base 3. hard to weld 4. easy to weld 5. good thermal conductivity 6. poor resistance to air corrosion||1, 3 and 5
aircraft-general-knowledge||in the event that an emergency decent causes the cabin pressure to decrease below ambient pressure:||the inward relief valve will open
aircraft-general-knowledge||in a bleed air anti-icing system the areas that are heated are:||wing leading edges and slats
aircraft-general-knowledge||the type of smoke detection system fitted to aircraft is:||optical and ionization
aircraft-general-knowledge||on a modern turboprop aircraft the method of anti-icing/de-icing the wings is:||pneumatic boots
aircraft-general-knowledge||how do you control power in a jet engine?||by controlling the fuel flow

aircraft-general-knowledge||if during pressurized flight the outflow valve closes fully due to a fault in the pressure controller the:||safety valve opens when the differential pressure reaches structural max diff
aircraft-general-knowledge||in a normally aspirated piston engine carburettor icing can occur:||in temperature ranges of -7°c to as high as +33°c with visible moisture present
aircraft-general-knowledge||oxygen cylinders are normally charged to:||1800 psi
aircraft-general-knowledge||what is the purpose of the fcoc (fuel-cooled oil cooler)?||to heat the fuel and cool the oil
aircraft-general-knowledge||in an air cycle air conditioning system what is the function of the ground-cooling fan?||to draw cooling air over the heat exchangers
aircraft-general-knowledge||what is the purpose of inboard ailerons:?||to reduce wing twist at high speed
aircraft-general-knowledge||the thrust reverser light illuminates on the flight deck annunciator when the:||thrust reverser doors have moved to the reverse thrust position
aircraft-general-knowledge||in an ac distribution system what is the purpose of the gcb?||connects a generator output to its load busbar
aircraft-general-knowledge||in very cold weather the pilot notices slightly higher than normal oil pressure on start up. this:||is acceptable providing it returns to normal after start up.
aircraft-general-knowledge||kreuger flaps are positioned:||at the wing inner leading edge
aircraft-general-knowledge||an aircraft which uses dc as the primary source of power, ac for the instruments may be obtained from:||inverter
aircraft-general-knowledge||in a gas turbine engine fuel system why is the fuel heater before the filter?||to prevent water in the fuel freezing and blocking the filter
aircraft-general-knowledge||susceptibility to hypoxia is increased by:||smoking
aircraft-general-knowledge||what are flaperons?||combined flap and ailerons
aircraft-general-knowledge||what is the purpose of trim tabs?||to reduce stick holding forces to zero
aircraft-general-knowledge||oxygen supplied to the flight deck is:||gaseous, diluted with cabin air if required
aircraft-general-knowledge||a hot busbar is one that:||is permanently connected to the battery
aircraft-general-knowledge||smoke hoods protect:||full face and provide a continuous flow of oxygen
aircraft-general-knowledge||in a fan jet engine the bypass ratio is:||external mass airflow divided by internal mass airflow
aircraft-general-knowledge||an artificial feel system is needed in the pitch channel if the:||elevators are controlled through an irreversible servo system
aircraft-general-knowledge||an axial flow compressor when compared to a centrifugal compressor:||takes in more air and is more prone to rupturing
aircraft-general-knowledge||what voltage is supplied to booster pumps on a modern jet airliner?||200 v ac three phase
aircraft-general-knowledge||the egt indication on a piston engine is used:||to assist the pilot to adjust the fuel mixture
aircraft-general-knowledge||what makes the non-rigid fittings of compressor and turbine blades rigid when the engine is running?||aerodynamic and centrifugal force
aircraft-general-knowledge||where are smoke detectors fitted?||toilets and cargo compartments b, c, e
aircraft-general-knowledge||what frequency is commonly used in aircraft electrical distribution systems?||400 hz
aircraft-general-knowledge||what colour is the hydraulic liquid in a modern jet airliner?||purple
aircraft-general-knowledge||auto brakes are disengaged:||by the pilot
aircraft-general-knowledge||when does the low-pressure fuel shut off valve close?||when the fire handle is pulled
aircraft-general-knowledge||in an aircraft with a fuel dumping system it will allow fuel to be dumped:||down to a predetermined safe value
aircraft-general-knowledge||when does the engine high pressure fuel shut off valve close?||when the engine fuel switch is selected off during engine shutdown
aircraft-general-knowledge||hydraulic pressure typically used in the system of large transport aircraft is:||3000-4000 psi
aircraft-general-knowledge||a gas turbine engine having a single spool, the compressor will rotate:||at the same speed as the turbine
aircraft-general-knowledge||what ice protection system is used on most modern jet transport aircraft?||hot air
aircraft-general-knowledge||the fuel cross-feed valves are fitted in order to facilitate:||the use of fuel from any tank to any engine
aircraft-general-knowledge||which part of the gas turbine engine limits the temperature?||turbine
aircraft-general-knowledge||when smoke appears in the cockpit, after donning the oxygen mask the pilot should select:||emergency
aircraft-general-knowledge||what does "octane rating" when applied to avgas refer to?||the anti-knock value of the fuel
aircraft-general-knowledge||what is the purpose of the torque links in a landing gear leg?||to prevent the wheel rotating around the leg
aircraft-general-knowledge||on what principle does the fuel contents gauging system work on a modern large aircraft?||changes in dielectric causes changes in capacitance
aircraft-general-knowledge||what is the purpose of a surge box inside a fuel tank?||prevent sloshing of fuel away from pump inlet during abnormal manoeuvres
aircraft-general-knowledge||the requirement for an aircraft to have a fuel dumping system is:||aircraft whose maximum landing mass (mlm) is significantly lower than its maximum take-off mass (mtom)

aircraft-general-knowledge||an unpressurized aircraft is flying above fl100 and therefore must have sufficient oxygen for:||both pilots immediately and the cabin crew plus some passengers after 30 minutes above fl100 but below fl130
aircraft-general-knowledge||in a stressed skin aircraft, bending loads acting on the wings are taken by:||spars and skin
aircraft-general-knowledge||what limits the max. temperature in a gas turbine engine?||temperature at the turbine
aircraft-general-knowledge||why, in the bootstrap system, is the air compressed before it enters the heat exchanger?||to ensure maximum pressure and temperature drop across the turbine
aircraft-general-knowledge||what is the purpose of the diluter demand valve in the emergency oxygen system?||to dilute oxygen with air in crew oxygen system
aircraft-general-knowledge||in a non-stressed skin aircraft, bending loads acting on the wings are taken by:||spars
aircraft-general-knowledge||aircraft above a certain capacity must carry a crash axe, it is provided to:||enable access behind panels and soundproofing to aid fire fighting
aircraft-general-knowledge||at what height is it mandatory for one of the flight deck crew to wear an oxygen mask?||41000 ft
aircraft-general-knowledge||hydraulic fluid:||is harmful to eyes and skin, and is also a fire hazard
aircraft-general-knowledge||the function of stringers in the construction of the fuselage is:||to provide support for the skin and to absorb some of the pressurization strain as tensile loading
aircraft-general-knowledge||on what principle does a fuel flowmeter work?||quantity of movement
aircraft-general-knowledge||the engine fire extinguisher system is activated:||by the pilot when required
aircraft-general-knowledge||what is a ram air turbine (rat) which drives a hydraulic pump used for?||flight controls in case of failure of the engine driven system
aircraft-general-knowledge||what is engine pressure ratio?||the ratio of turbine outlet pressure to compressor inlet pressure
aircraft-general-knowledge||emergency oxygen is provided by:||two independent systems, one for flight deck, one for cabin
aircraft-general-knowledge||as altitude increases what does the mixture control do to the fuel flow?||reduces flow due to reduced air density
aircraft-general-knowledge||what is the coefficient of friction on an aquaplaning (hydroplaning) tyre?||0

air-law||an aircraft making an approach must be told to make a missed approach, when no landing clearance has been received from the non-radar traffic controller, when the aircraft is at a distance of:||2 nm from the touchdown.
air-law||the speed limit (ias) in airspace e is:||250 kt for ifr and vfr, below fl100.
air-law||what action should be taken when, during an ifr flight in vmc, you suffer a radio failure?||continue flying in vmc and land as soon as possible.
air-law||who is responsible for the safety of an atc clearance concerning terrain clearance?||the captain.

air-law||an ats airspace, in which ifr and vfr flights are permitted and all flights receive air traffic control service, ifr flights are separated from other ifr flights and receive traffic information concerning vfr flights and vfr flights receive traffic information concerning all other flights, is classified as:||airspace d
air-law||what does der mean?||departure end of runway.
air-law||in mode 2 parallel runway operations, a minimum radar separation can be provided of:||3 nm between aircraft on the same localizer course.
air-law||except in special cases, the establishment of change-over points shall be limited to route segments of:||60 nm or more.
air-law||for a controlled flight before departure, a flight plan must be filed at least:||60 minutes before departure.
air-law||in an instrument approach procedure, the segment where the aircraft is lined up with the runway centre line and when the decent is commenced is called:||final approach segment.
air-law||except when cleared by an atc unit, a vfr flight cannot enter or leave a control zone when the cloud base is lower than:||1500 ft or less than 5 km visibility.
air-law||icao annex 17 lays down the rules to establish security measures for passengers with regard to:||cabin baggage, checked baggage, cargo and other goods, access control and airport design.
air-law||when doing a procedure turn (45°/180°) going outbound turned 45° off track, the time taken from the beginning of the turn for cat a and cat b aircraft is:||1 minute.
air-law||when requesting to engage the parking brake, a marshaller will give the following signal:||raise arm and hand with fingers extended horizontally in front of the body. then clench fist.
air-law||concerning the three entries to the hold, the entry has to be flown on:||heading

air-law||an aircraft, on a radar approach, should be told to consider making a missed approach when the aircraft is not visible on the radar screen for a significant period of time and when it is within:||the last 2 nm of the approach.
air-law||clocks and other timing equipment used by air traffic services must be checked in order to be able to give the time within plus or minus:||30 seconds of utc.
air-law||when given instructions to set a mode/code, a pilot shall:||read back mode and code.
air-law||in order to satisfy lateral track separation between aircraft using the same fix and dead reckoning, the aircraft:||have to fly 45° separated at a distance of 15 nm or more from the fix.
air-law||who has the final authority as to the disposition of the aircraft?||the commander.

air-law||what is the rule concerning level or height the aircraft should maintain when flying ifr outside controlled airspace unless otherwise directed?||1000 ft above the highest obstacle within 8 km of the estimated position of the aircraft.
air-law||it says in the annex of the icao convention that the sizes of airfields are specified by codes for different runways. what is the minimum width of a runway with runway code 4?||45 m.
air-law||a manoeuvre where a turn is made from a "designated track" followed by a turn in the opposite direction to enable the aircraft to fly the prescribed track is called a:||procedure turn.
air-law||how many red lights have to be seen by the pilot, whose aircraft on final approach follows a normal papi defined glide-path?||2
air-law||if the track on an instrument departure is published, the pilot is expected to:||correct for the known wind so as to maintain the published track.
air-law||transition level:||will be calculated by the atc service of an ats unit.
air-law||the person having overall responsibility of an aircraft during flight is the:||pilot-in-command.

air-law||an aircraft which is not concerned with regular international flights and which makes a flight to or via a dedicated aerodrome of a member state and is temporarily free of taxes is admitted and will stay within that state without paying customs:||during a period which is determined by the state.

air-law||when someone's admittance to a country is refused and he/she is brought back to the operator for transportation away from the territory of the state:||the operator will not be prevented from taking any transportation costs from a person which arises out of his/her inadmissibility.
air-law||a clearway is a squared area that is established to:||enable the aircraft to make a part of the initial climb to a specified altitude.
air-law||close to an aerodrome that will be used for landing by aircraft, the vertical position shall be expressed as:||altitude above sea level at or below transition altitude.

air-law||aircraft a flies in vmc with an atc clearance within a control area. aircraft b without atc clearance approaches at roughly the same height on a converging heading. who has right of way?||aircraft b, if a is to the left of him.
air-law||concerning aircraft registration markings, no combinations can be used if they can be mistaken for:||5 letter combinations which are used by international code of signals.

air-law||an aircraft flies over mountainous terrain at which a search and rescue operation is conducted to find survivors of a plane crash. the pilot sees a ground sign in the form of an "x". this indicates:||require medical assistance.

air-law||temporary changes of long duration in specifications for aip supplements and information of short duration, which contains extensive text and / or graphical representation, has to be published as aip supplements. long duration is considered to be:||3 months or longer.

air-law||a controlled flight is required to inform the concerned atc unit when the average tas at cruising level deviates or is expected to deviate compared to that given tas in the flight plan by at least plus or minus:||5%.
air-law||an aircraft is expected to overtake another aircraft if it is closing from behind in a sector of:||70° both sides of the longitudinal axis.
air-law||pilots are not allowed to use the ident function on their ssr, unless:||if asked by atc.
air-law||the transition from altitude to flight level and visa versa is made:||at the transition altitude in the climb and transition level in the descent.

air-law||it is permitted in a particular sector, if there is a conspicuous obstacle in the visual manoeuvring area outside the final and missed approach areas, to disregard that obstacle. when using this option, the published procedure shall be:||forbid a circling approach in the entire sector in which the obstacle is located.
air-law||an aircraft is allowed to descend below the msa if:||all of the above.
air-law||lights on an airfield or in the vicinity can be extinguished if they can be re-lit:||at least 60 minutes before the eta of the aircraft.
air-law||air traffic service unit consists of:||air traffic control units, flight information centres and air traffic services reporting offices.
air-law||a marshaller crosses his/her hands in front of the face, palms outwards and then moves the arms outwards. what does this signal indicate?||remove chocks.
air-law||a fixed obstacle that extends above a take-off climb surface within ___ shall be marked and, if the runway is to be used at night, must be lit.||3000 m

air-law||repetitive flight plans (rpls) cannot be used for flights other than those executed frequently on the same days of following weeks and:||for at least 10 occasions or every day over a period of at least 10 consecutive days.
air-law||a papi must consist of:||a row of 4 multiple lights or paired units without transition zone, at equal distance from each other.
air-law||what is the length of the approach lighting system of a cat ii precision landing runway?||900 m.

air-law||according to international agreements the wind direction must be given in degrees magnetic converted with local magnetic variation from the true wind direction:||before landing and taxi for take-off.

air-law||an aircraft is maintaining fl150 in class c airspace. another aircraft below at fl140 receives a clearance to descend to fl70. there is severe turbulence in the area. when at earliest can a clearance be expected to descend to fl140 or lower?||when the other aircraft has reported to be descending through fl130.
air-law||the vmc minima for a vfr flight within ats airspace class b are:||8 km visibility at or above 3050 m amsl, 1500 m horizontal and 300 m vertical clear of cloud.

air-law||when independent parallel approaches are used on parallel runways and headings (vectors) are given to intercept the ils, the given heading must be such that the aeroplane can establish on the localizer course or the mls final approach track in level flight over at least:||2.0 nm before the ils glide slope or the specified mls elevation angle is intercepted.
air-law||when the captain cannot comply with an atc clearance:||he/she may request an amended clearance and, if executable, he/she will accept that clearance.
air-law||the minimum number of rescue and fire fighting vehicles required for a cat 8 aerodrome is:||3
air-law||lights at the end of the runway shall be:||steady unidirectional lights radiating red light in the direction of the runway.
air-law||what is required for an ifr flight in advisory airspace?||flight plan required and pic must notify of any changes regardless if wanting advisory service or not.
air-law||the transition from ifr to vfr is done:||on the captain's initiative.

air-law||the longitudinal separation minimum based on time between aircraft at the same fl, where there is enough coverage for navigation aids and the preceding aircraft has a higher true airspeed of 20 kt minimum is:||5 minutes.

air-law||the minimum response time for the aerodrome rescue and fire fighting services to the end of each runway as well as to any other part of the movement area is:||2 minutes and not exceeding 3 minutes.
air-law||what is the separation that must be maintained before intercepting the ils on an independent parallel approach?||1000 ft.
air-law||a type rating is applicable to:||an aircraft that requires multi-pilot operation.
air-law||fixed distance markers, when provided, shall commence:||300 metres from the threshold.
air-law||what is the minimum width of a code 4 runway?||45 m.
air-law||a toda consists of:||the take-off run available including the clearway.

air-law||temporary changes of long duration (3 months or more) and information of short duration which contains extensive graphics and/or text are published as aip supplements. check lists of these supplements which are in force are sent to recipients at intervals of not more than:||one month.
air-law||the operator is responsible for the custody and care of the passengers. this responsibility shall terminate:||from the moment they have been admitted into the destination state.
air-law||if an aircraft is radar vectored to intercept an ils localizer, what is the maximum intercept angle?||30°.
air-law||if no icao identifier has been attributed to an aerodrome, what should be entered in box 16 of the flight plan?||zzzz.
air-law||what is the width of a code letter d taxiway used by aircraft with an outer gear wheel span of more than 9 m ?||23 m.
air-law||which international agreement relates to penal law?||tokyo
air-law||the continued validity of a c of a (certificate of airworthiness) of an aircraft is subject to the laws of:||the state of registration.

air-law||an rnp1 route designated as a342y, indicates that the route is at or above fl200 and all turns shall be made within the allowable rnp tolerance of a tangential arc between the straight leg segments with a radius of:||22.5 nm for turns between 30° and 90°
air-law||atis will only broadcast cloud base information when the cloud base is:||5000 ft

air-law||voice atis: 1. cannot be broadcast on a voice ils 2. cannot be broadcast on voice vor 3. is broadcast only on a discreet vhf frequency 4. is broadcast on either a discreet vfh, vor or an ils frequency||4 only is correct
air-law||which of the following is not a valid ssr mode a squawk?||a5678

air-law||what are the objectives of atc services?||to prevent collisions between aircraft, to prevent collisions between aircraft on the manoeuvring area and obstructions on that area and to expedite and maintain an orderly flow of air traffic

air-law||an rnp1 route designated as a342z, indicates that the route is at or below fl190 and all turns shall be made within the allowable rnp tolerance of a tangential arc between the straight leg segments with a radius of:||15 nm for turns between 30° and 90°
air-law||what is the meaning of the signal lll from search parties?||operation completed
air-law||a check list of aip supplements is published:||monthly

air-law||a heavy aircraft makes a missed approach on a parallel runway in the opposite direction. a light aircraft has a wake turbulence separation of 2 minutes. this wake turbulence separation will apply when the parallel runways are:||less than 760 m apart

air-law||in the event of a delay of a controlled flight, the flight plan shall be amended or cancelled and a new flight plan submitted should that delay be in excess of:||30 mins of estimated off-blocks time (eobt)
air-law||what is the co-pilot currency requirement?||at the controls for 3 take-offs and landings in the last 90 days
air-law||a list to be carried in the aeroplane detailing minimum equipment required must be approved by:||country of operator
air-law||the "no smoking" sign must be illuminated:||when oxygen is being supplied in the cabin
air-law||refer to training manual, amsterdam page 10-9x. what is the minimum radio altitude for a cat 2 ils dme approach to runway 01l?||100 ft

air-law||a separation minima shall be applied between a light or medium aircraft and a heavy and between a light and a medium aircraft when the heavier aircraft is making a low or missed approach and the lighter aircraft is utilizing an opposite direction runway on a parallel runway separated by:||less than 760 m.
air-law||according to easa part-fcl, recognized instructor categories are:||fi(a), tri(a), cri(a). iri(a), mcci(a) and sfi(a) only.
air-law||independent parallel approaches may be conducted to parallel runways provided that an ntz (non transgression zone) of at least:||610 m wide is established between extended centre lines.

air-law||when a state renders valid a licence issued by another contracting state, as an alternative to issuance of its own licence, the validity shall:||not extend beyond the period of validity of the licence.
air-law||atis broadcasts contain cloud details whenever the:||cloud ceiling is below 5000 ft or the highest msa (whichever is the higher)

air-law||contracting states shall carry out the handling, forwarding and clearance of airmail and shall comply with the documentary procedures as prescribed by:||the acts in force of the universal postal union.
air-law||for an instrument runway, how far from the centre line of the runway is a "runway vacated" sign positioned?||at the end of the ils/mls sensitive area.
air-law||the international civil aviation organization (icao) establishes:||standards and recommended international practices for contracting member states.

air-law||an area symmetrical about the extended runway centre line and adjacent to the end of the strip, primarily intended to reduce the risk of damage to an aircraft undershooting or overrunning the runway is defined as a:||runway end safety area.
air-law||where in the aip would you find details on instrument holding procedures?||enr

air-law||according to easa part-fcl, an applicant for a cpl (a) who has satisfactorily followed and completed an integrated flying training course shall have completed as a pilot of aeroplanes having a certificate of airworthiness issued or accepted by an easa member state at least:||150 hours of flight time.
air-law||what is required if a stop bar is not provided at a runway entrance and the runway is to be used with rvr of less than 550 m?||runway guard lights.

air-law||according to annex 7, the registration mark shall be letters, numbers or a combination of letters and numbers and shall be that assigned by:||the state of registry or common mark registering authority.

air-law||when an aircraft subjected to unlawful interference has landed in a contracting state, it shall notify by the most expeditious means the state of registry and the state of the operator of the landing and, in addition, shall similarly transmit all other relevant information to:||each state whose citizens suffered fatalities or injuries, each state whose citizens were detained as hostages, each state whose citizens were known to be on board and icao.
air-law||the state of registration is:||the state where the aircraft is currently registered

air-law||a contracting state which continues to require the presentation of a cargo manifest shall, apart from the information indicated in the heading of the format of the cargo manifest, not require more than the following items:||airway bill number, the number of packages and the nature of goods.

air-law||according to easa part-fcl, the privileges of the holder of an unrestricted fi(a) rating are to conduct flight instruction for the issue of a cpl(a):||provided that the fi(a) has completed at least 500 hours of flight time as a pilot of aeroplanes including at least 200 hours of flight instruction.
air-law||what action should be taken if contact is lost with the runway during a circling approach?||initiate a missed approach.
air-law||unaccompanied baggage carried by air shall be cleared under a procedure applicable to:||cargo.
aon-aviation-knowledge||which of the following statements regarding an electric circuit is correct?||too high a current may lead to the circuit overheating
aon-aviation-knowledge||the purpose of an ignition switch is to:||control the primary circuit of the magneto
aon-aviation-knowledge||which of the following are all aerodynamic balances?||horn balance, balance tab and internal balance.
aon-aviation-knowledge||propeller blade angle is:||the angle between the blade chord and the plane of rotation
aon-aviation-knowledge||the skin of a modern pressurised aircraft:||is a primary load bearing structure carrying much of the loads
aon-aviation-knowledge||what does tem stand for in the context of human performance?||threat and error management
aon-aviation-knowledge||what is the shortest distance between two points on the earth's globe called:||great circle
aon-aviation-knowledge||leaving ground effect at a given angle of attack the:||effective angle of attack decreases.
aon-aviation-knowledge||a turbo-supercharger impeller is driven by:||diversion of exhaust gases by the waste gate using energy that would otherwise be wasted
aon-aviation-knowledge||the weight of an aeroplane, which is in level non accelerated flight, is said to act:||vertically through the centre of gravity
aon-aviation-knowledge||when an aircraft fitted with a classic air-driven artificial horizon decelerates after landing, a wrong indication will be displayed showing a:||climbing turn to right.
aon-aviation-knowledge||during a climb a blocked static pressure supply line causes the asi to:||under-indicate
aon-aviation-knowledge||flutter may be caused by a:||distortion by bending and torsion of the structure causing increasing vibration in the resonance frequency.
aon-aviation-knowledge||with regards to the maximum zero fuel weight (mzfw):||it is the maximum weight that an aircraft can be loaded to without useable fuel.
aon-aviation-knowledge||what is the effect on mach no and tas when climbing at a constant cas?||both increase
aon-aviation-knowledge||what is the purpose of trim tabs?||to reduce stick forces to zero
aon-aviation-knowledge||the minimum separation between vhf frequencies in europe is:||8.33khz
aon-aviation-knowledge||what can be said about the height of the tropopause in the northern hemisphere?||it decreases from south to north
aon-aviation-knowledge||the ils localiser operates in the following frequency band:||108.0-112.0 mhz
aon-aviation-knowledge||what is the correct phrase for a pilot to use to advise atc of being ready to take-off?||ready for departure.
